subject: Re: [junit] class not found exception
msgSnippet: So said  suresh  on  2002-11-26 ... The test name should be a class name; not a file name. My guess is that just TempTest will do the job. If it were in
messageBody:
So said suresh on 2002-11-26

>hi i am trying to run a Junit test case from the ant script and i got
>following error. All my files are placed in d:\src directory without
>any package names. TempTest is name of the class. any suggestions
>please ?
>
><junit printsummary="yes" fork="yes" haltonfailure="no">
> <formatter type="plain"/>
> <test name="D:/src/TempTest" outfile="result">

The test name should be a class name; not a file name. My guess is that
just "TempTest" will do the job. If it were in package "xyz.foo", then
you want "xyz.foo.TempTest".
